intro: Cotula zeyheri, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a low-growing perennial that produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of white and yellow. The plant has hairy, lobed leaves and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It is well adapted to dry conditions and is sometimes used in traditional medicine. Cotula zeyheri is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in coastal environments.
